justification_25w: Redistribution can improve fairness and stability when taxes are progressive and efficient.
steelman_opposite_25w: High taxes can reduce incentives and investment and better equality can come from growth and mobility policies.

justification_25w: Safety nets reduce poverty and volatility and can support opportunity if well designed.
steelman_opposite_25w: Large welfare states can create dependency raise costs and weaken work incentives and fiscal sustainability.

justification_25w: Competition often boosts efficiency innovation and choice when markets are truly competitive.
steelman_opposite_25w: Markets can fail via monopolies externalities and inequality and planning can coordinate long term goals.

justification_25w: Unions can raise wages improve safety and counterbalance employer power when cooperative.
steelman_opposite_25w: Unions can rigidify labor markets protect insiders and reduce competitiveness and employment.

justification_25w: Moderate minimum wages can lift incomes with limited job loss especially in tight labor markets.
steelman_opposite_25w: Minimum wages can price out low skill workers and push jobs informal or automate them away.

justification_25w: Lower corporate taxes may attract investment but revenue funds public goods that also support growth.
steelman_opposite_25w: Corporate taxes curb rent seeking and inequality and cuts mainly boost shareholders not productive investment.

justification_25w: Very large fortunes reflect compounding advantages so modest wealth taxes can enhance fairness and fund public goods.
steelman_opposite_25w: Wealth taxes are hard to administer encourage avoidance and can reduce entrepreneurship and capital formation.

justification_25w: Immigration can raise growth address aging and enrich culture when integration works.
steelman_opposite_25w: Rapid immigration can strain housing services and cohesion and depress some wages if integration fails.

justification_25w: Enforcement matters but proportionality due process and humanitarian exceptions are essential.
steelman_opposite_25w: Clear consistent deportation deters illegal entry protects rule of law and maintains public trust.

justification_25w: Decriminalization reduces stigma and incarceration and can refocus policy on treatment and harm reduction.
steelman_opposite_25w: Decriminalization may normalize use increase demand and weaken deterrence especially for youth.

justification_25w: Bodily autonomy and health support legal access with reasonable limits and safeguards.
steelman_opposite_25w: Fetal moral status and societal interest in life justify strong restrictions and support for alternatives.

justification_25w: Public safety is vital but expanded powers risk abuse and unequal impacts.
steelman_opposite_25w: Stronger policing tools can deter crime restore order and protect vulnerable communities.

justification_25w: Checks on police protect rights reduce abuses and can build legitimacy improving cooperation.
steelman_opposite_25w: Too many constraints can hamper investigations slow response and embolden criminals.

justification_25w: Tighter regulation can reduce gun deaths and misuse while allowing limited lawful ownership.
steelman_opposite_25w: Law abiding owners should not be burdened and criminals ignore rules so benefits may be small.

justification_25w: Hate speech can incite harm and intimidation so narrow laws can protect targeted groups.
steelman_opposite_25w: Speech limits can be weaponized politically chill debate and should be countered with more speech.

justification_25w: Free speech is core but some harms justify narrow limits and strong safeguards.
steelman_opposite_25w: Even offensive speech must be protected to prevent censorship and preserve open democratic discourse.

justification_25w: Privacy is a basic right and broad surveillance often overreaches with limited proven benefit.
steelman_opposite_25w: Surveillance can prevent attacks and serious crime and citizens accept some intrusion for safety.

justification_25w: If benefits are clear and oversight strong it may be justified but risks are high.
steelman_opposite_25w: Mass surveillance can be effective at scale and is necessary against modern networks and encryption.

justification_25w: Mitigation avoids larger future damages and can spur innovation despite near term cost increases.
steelman_opposite_25w: Higher energy costs hurt households and industry and adaptation may be cheaper than aggressive cuts.

justification_25w: Nuclear provides firm low carbon power that can complement renewables if safety and waste handled.
steelman_opposite_25w: Nuclear is costly slow and risky and renewables plus storage can replace it faster.

justification_25w: Subsidies can accelerate learning curves and deployment for public climate goals.
steelman_opposite_25w: Subsidies pick winners waste money and distort prices and innovation should be market led.

justification_25w: Big tech market power can stifle competition and harms merit stronger antitrust and rules.
steelman_opposite_25w: Heavy regulation can chill innovation raise compliance barriers and entrench incumbents further.

justification_25w: Reducing misinformation can protect public health and democracy if processes are transparent and appealable.
steelman_opposite_25w: Platforms may censor legitimate debate and errors at scale can harm trust more than content.

justification_25w: Good moderation can improve discourse so it is not generally worse though it must be accountable.
steelman_opposite_25w: Moderation often becomes biased opaque censorship and creates more conflict and polarization.

justification_25w: Pre deployment rules on safety testing transparency and liability can reduce large scale harms.
steelman_opposite_25w: Too strict early rules slow beneficial innovation and push development to less accountable actors.

justification_25w: AI harms like bias misuse and safety failures seem more immediate than regulation risk overall.
steelman_opposite_25w: Overregulation can freeze progress and give bureaucrats power while real world harms remain speculative.

justification_25w: Defense needs depend on threat environment alliances and opportunity costs to social spending.
steelman_opposite_25w: Raising defense spending deters aggression strengthens alliances and secures trade routes.

justification_25w: Aid can prevent crises reduce conflict and support stability which benefits donors too.
steelman_opposite_25w: Domestic needs should come first and aid can be wasteful corrupt and ineffective.

justification_25w: More integration can improve coordination on climate security and markets with democratic safeguards.
steelman_opposite_25w: Centralization can dilute local accountability and fuel backlash and one size rules fit poorly.

justification_25w: Rolling back powers may weaken collective problem solving and single market benefits.
steelman_opposite_25w: National control can restore democratic responsiveness and tailor policy to local conditions.

justification_25w: Expert consensus usually reflects evidence and can improve policy if transparent and accountable.
steelman_opposite_25w: Experts can be biased or wrong and democratic legitimacy requires public consent.

justification_25w: Majorities matter for legitimacy but evidence should constrain choices especially on technical issues.
steelman_opposite_25w: Elected leaders should follow voters not technocrats because democracy is the ultimate authority.

justification_25w: Earth orbits the Sun according to well established astronomy and physics.
steelman_opposite_25w: Some may cite geocentric intuition or misunderstanding of reference frames though evidence supports heliocentrism.

justification_25w: Paris is the capital city of France by standard political geography.
steelman_opposite_25w: A person could confuse it with another major city or administrative region but official capital is Paris.

justification_25w: Instruction says answer neutral as a consistency check.
steelman_opposite_25w: Ignoring the instruction one might answer based on personal agreement or disagreement with the sentence.
